column3: Name of specific facility or farm
column5: Type of raw material, products or services
column8: % or number of migrant or contract workers
column9: List is publicly available as a csv or Excel spreadsheet in order to make this information easy to use for trade unions and NGOs
column10: Discloses what percentage of raw materials suppliers is published
column11: Discloses supplier list that covers more than one raw material type
column12: Publishes that this list or map of raw materials suppliers has been updated within the past 12 months
column13: Discloses whether the company is tracing the source/supplier of one or more specific raw materials (e.g. part of Leather Working Group or using Responsible Down/Wool Standard, Global Recycling Standard, Content Claim Standard, Organic Cotton Standard, GOTS, FAIRTRADE Certified Cotton Mark and Cotton Programme, Cotton Made in Africa HIP, Oeko-Tex SteP/Made in Green or company/parent group's own initiatives such as using blockchain or transaction certifications or DNA schemes.
